# GPU Dedicated Servers  
for deep learning, graphics rendering, video transcoding, computation, or
working with neural networks

Do you know exactly which server you need?

Build server

Need help building a server?

Write us

##  Enjoy all the advantages of renting GPU server

1

The control

All server resources belong to you without the neighboring virtual machines of
other users. If you wish, you can manage the server remotely.

Reliability

Certified data centers provide high throughput, performance, resiliency, and
connection speed.

Money

You save on equipment and maintenance. Data centers are the most modern,
reliable, powerful equipment with configured infrastructure.

Efficiency

You can build the server yourself or choose from the already prepared
configurations. The time needed to build your server starts from 1 hour.

Resources

No need for additional staff - we take care of all technical support and
provide it 24*7.

Safety

Reliable data centers in Europe and America provide both physical security of
servers and legal protection.

We will help you choose a server

for any of your tasks

Write us

## Available GPU Accelerators

  * Nvidia NVS 315
  * Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1050 Ti
  * Nvidia Tesla V100
  * Nvidia Quadro P5000
  * Gigabyte Radeon RX 6400
  * Asus Radeon RX 6400
  * Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 Ti 11GB

#### Nvidia NVS 315

  * CUDA cores: 48
  * Boost: N/A
  * Base: 523 MHz
  * 1GB DDR3 64-bit memory

The Nvidia NVS 315 is a low-profile graphics card designed for professional
applications. It offers 1GB of DDR3 memory and supports multiple displays with
its dual-link DVI and DisplayPort outputs. The NVS 315 is optimized for
stability and reliability in business environments, making it suitable for
tasks such as video playback, 2D graphics, and multi-display setups. It is an
entry-level GPU with a focus on providing efficient and dependable performance
for everyday professional computing needs.

Available GPUs

#### Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1050 Ti

  * 768 CUDA cores
  * Boost: 1468 MHz 
  * Base: 1354 MHz
  * 4GB GDDR5 128bit memory

The Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1050 Ti is a compact graphics card designed for
entry-level gaming and multimedia tasks. It features 4GB of GDDR5 memory and
offers a range of display outputs, including DisplayPort, HDMI, and DVI-D.
With its energy-efficient design and NVIDIA Pascal architecture, it provides
decent gaming performance for popular titles at 1080p resolution. The GTX 1050
Ti is suitable for budget-conscious gamers and users seeking a reliable GPU
for casual gaming and everyday multimedia tasks.

Available GPUs

#### Nvidia Tesla V100

  * 5120 CUDA cores
  * Boost: 1380 MHz
  * Base: 1246 MHz
  * 16GB GDDR5 4096-bit memory

The Nvidia Tesla V100 is a powerful data center GPU designed for high-
performance computing and artificial intelligence tasks. It is built on the
Volta architecture and provides substantial computational capabilities. With a
high number of CUDA cores and tensor cores, it accelerates deep learning and
scientific simulations efficiently. The V100 is equipped with 16GB of HBM2
memory, enabling fast data access and processing. Its impressive performance
of up to 125 teraflops makes it a preferred choice for researchers,
enterprises, and developers looking to tackle complex computational
challenges. Its versatility and cutting-edge features have made it a key
player in advancing AI and scientific research.  

Available GPUs

#### Nvidia Quadro P5000

  * CUDA cores: 2560
  * Boost: 1800 MHz
  * Base: 1127 MHz
  * 16GB GDDR5 256-bit memory

The Nvidia Quadro P5000 is a professional-grade graphics card aimed at
demanding workstations and design applications. It features 16GB of GDDR5X
memory and a high number of CUDA cores, providing substantial computing power
for complex simulations and rendering tasks. The Quadro P5000 supports
multiple displays and comes equipped with specialized drivers and features
optimized for professional software, making it ideal for tasks such as 3D
modeling, animation, and video editing.

Available GPUs

#### Gigabyte Radeon RX 6400

  * Cores: 768
  * Boost: 2321 MHz
  * Base: 2039 MHz
  * 4GB GDDR5 128-bit memory

The Gigabyte Radeon RX 6400 is an efficient graphics card, purpose-built to
enhance gaming and content creation experiences for budget-minded consumers.
An integral part of Gigabyte's graphics offerings, this card melds
affordability with commendable performance. Crafted with the robust technology
of AMD's Radeon series, it's a go-to choice for casual gamers and creators
needing superior graphics. Its adaptability across different systems, coupled
with Gigabyte's reputation for reliability, makes this card a valuable
addition to any personal computing setup.

Available GPUs

#### Asus Radeon RX 6400

  * Cores: 768
  * Boost: 2321 MHz
  * Base: 2039 MHz
  * 4GB GDDR5 128-bit memory

The Asus Radeon RX 6400 is an impressive, budget-friendly graphics card
designed to enrich gaming and multimedia experiences. It seamlessly merges the
power of AMD's Radeon technology with Asus's innovative design and quality
craftsmanship. Ideal for casual gamers and creators, this card is recognized
for its affordable performance. Its broad system compatibility, paired with
Asus's commitment to durability and reliability, positions the Radeon RX 6400
as an excellent choice for those seeking an effective upgrade in graphics
capability.

Available GPUs

#### Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 Ti 11GB

  * CUDA cores: 4352
  * Boost: 1545 MHz
  * Base: 1350 MHz
  * 11GB GDDR6 352-bit memory

The Nvidia GeForce RTX 2080 Ti 11GB is a powerhouse graphics card, standing
out in the high-end sector of the market. It integrates Nvidia's advanced
technologies, delivering stunning gaming visuals and handling complex
computing tasks with ease. This card is a popular choice for hardcore gamers
and professional creators, thanks to its exceptional graphics performance and
impressive computational abilities. Combining high-capacity memory and
Nvidia's renowned build quality, the RTX 2080 Ti offers an unmatched graphical
experience for those demanding the best.

## Get answers to all our questions

6

  * What is the advantage of using a GPU dedicated server?

GPU dedicated servers provide superior processing performance for tasks that
require intensive computation, such as machine learning algorithms, 3D
rendering, cryptocurrency mining, and other parallel processing tasks. The
presence of a dedicated GPU means these tasks are performed much faster
compared to a traditional CPU.

  * Can I use a GPU dedicated server for gaming purposes?

Absolutely! GPU dedicated servers are ideal for hosting game servers because
they can handle high-resolution graphics and multiple users simultaneously
without compromising performance.

  * What industries commonly use GPU dedicated servers?

GPU dedicated servers are used across various industries that require high-
performance computing. This includes Artificial Intelligence, Machine
Learning, Data Science, Video Rendering, Cryptocurrency Mining, and Gaming
industries.

  * How are GPU dedicated servers different from regular servers?

The key difference lies in the processing power. Regular servers primarily
rely on CPUs, which are excellent for general-purpose computing. On the other
hand, GPU-dedicated servers are equipped with Graphics Processing Units that
excel in parallel processing and are ideal for tasks that require intensive
computations.

  * Are GPU dedicated servers customizable?

Yes, we offer customizable options to suit your specific needs. This could
involve choosing the type and number of GPUs, the amount of RAM, the type of
CPU, and storage options.

  * Are GPU dedicated servers secure?

Yes, like other types of dedicated servers, GPU dedicated servers are
typically secure. You have full control over the server, meaning you can
implement your own security measures.

  * How much does a GPU dedicated server cost?

The cost of dedicated GPU servers varies greatly depending on the specific
configuration, such as the type and number of GPUs, amount of RAM, processor
type, and storage options. The cost usually starts from a few tens of euros
per month and can increase depending on the specifics.

  * Do I need specific knowledge to manage a GPU dedicated server?

GPU servers require the same technical knowledge as regular dedicated servers.
In addition, the INTROSERV team can assist you with configuration, maintenance
and solving technical issues.

  * Can I upgrade my GPU dedicated server if my needs increase over time?

Yes, we offer scalability. This means that you can upgrade your server
resources as your needs grow, whether that means more memory, more RAM, or a
more powerful GPU.

Performance cookies are used to see how visitors use the website, eg.
analytics cookies. Those cookies cannot be used to directly identify a certain
visitor.

_pk_id.1.2aab |  introserv.com  | 1 year | This cookie name is associated with

and letters, which is believed to be a reference code for the domain setting
the cookie.  
_gat_UA-106797224-1 |  .introserv.com  | 59 seconds | This is a pattern type
